title: Cruel dad abandoned his terrified toddler daughter in a cemetery in a bizarre stunt to try and win back his ex-wife
text:
Opinion 'SHE TURNED PURPLE FROM THE COLD' Cruel dad abandoned his terrified toddler daughter in a cemetery in a bizarre stunt to try and win back his ex-wife 
The girl, aged just two, was found crying and shivering in the cold BY SAM WEBB Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A DESPERATE divorced dad put his toddler daughter’s life at risk by abandoning her in in a bizarre bid to force his ex-wife to remarry him. 
The girl, aged just two, was found crying and shivering in the cold by villagers in Lifu Township, which is in Qu County in south-western China’s Sichuan Province. AsiaWire The tiny, terrified girl was left alone in a cemetery and cops are now looking for her dad AsiaWire She was tied to bamboo and abandoned. Villagers found the cold and terrified girl 
They claimed the girl’s lips had turned purple from the cold. 
She was tied to bamboo and also wore a sign on her back bearing some personal information, which identified her by the nickname ‘Dian Dian’ and claimed she was the child of a woman surnamed Wang. Dian Dian’s father, surnamed Luo, is believed to have abandoned her next to her grandmother’s grave after numerous failed attempts to convince Wang to remarry him. 
Wang, who lives with her second husband as well as her first daughter from her marriage with Luo, said she refused her ex, and that he most likely left Dian Dian by the grave to threaten and frighten her into accepting his demands. AsiaWire 3 The cruel act is believed to be a bizarre bid by the ex-husband to force his ex-wife to get back with him 
The villagers who found Dian Dian in the eerie and deserted place took care of her until the authorities arrived to take over. 
Local police handed Dian Dian over to her mum later the same day but have yet to track down Luo. 
The irresponsible father, however, is expected to face heavy punishment for abandoning his child. 
Last month a teenage mum was arrested on suspicion of abandoning her baby outside a Kent supermarket.
